Read Gradescope CSV File

Source: R/read-gs.R
read_gs.Rd

This functions reads the Gradescope CSV file and checks for correct Gradescope format. Each assignment should follow the four-column format: Assignment Name, Assignment Name - Max Points, Assignment Name - Submission Time, Assignment Name - Lateness (H:M:S). All other columns are designed as ID columns.

Now it is favored to use read_files. This function is left for backwards-compatibility.

Usage

read_gs(path, verbose = FALSE)

Arguments

path

Path to Gradescope CSV

verbose

whether or not to print messages

Value

A dataframe of Gradescope CSV file, if no errors

Examples

path <- system.file("extdata", "gs_demo.csv", package = "gradebook")
read_gs(path = path)
#> New names:
#> • `` -> `...1`
#> Rows: 10 Columns: 45
#> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr  (13): Names, Email, Sections, Lab 1 - Submission Time, Lab 2 - Su...
#> dbl  (22): ...1, SID, Lab 1, Lab 1 - Max Points, Lab 2, Lab 2 - Max Po...
#> time (10): Lab 1 - Lateness (H:M:S), Lab 2 - Lateness (H:M:S), Lab 3 -...
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
